title: The Bow Of The Winds
opening: Roy headed towards the ruins in Sacae, after the Divine Weapon.
However, the remaining forces of the Djute clan were waiting for Roy in the

intro.speaker: Thoril
intro.line: They won’t stop until they make everything theirs... We will not let that happen. Tell our brothers that we will defend this land to the death. We will avenge our dead comrades!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: The Divine Weapon lies here... Sin, do you know about this place?

intro.speaker: Sin
intro.line: All I know is that the Divine Warrior Hanon’s bow, the Miurgre, or the Bow of the Winds, is kept here.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Hanon... She and Saint Elimine were the only two women among the Eight Heroes.

intro.speaker: Sin
intro.line: So it seems. ...Watch your back. The Djute will give us everything they’ve got to avenge their clansmen.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: All right, we have to be careful. Let’s go!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: It’s here! The bow is hidden in the altar!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: This is the Miurgre... It looks like an ordinary bow, but it must have incredible power.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy, Bern’s troops are retreating.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Oh. All right.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: All right? We must give chase.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: No, don’t. They’re fleeing. They don’t have any more will to fight.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: But...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: They have families as well. There’s no need to fight more than necessary.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Merlinus, I need you to send this letter to Bishop Yoder in Etruria.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: A letter? May I ask what it says?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: It’s the story we heard from Niime about the Dragons.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Oh? What did you discuss with her about the Dragons?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: It’ll be long if I tell you. I haven’t sealed the letter yet, so you can look through it if you want.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: All right. Let me see...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...Roy.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess, is something wrong?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...We enter Bern now.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes. We will attack Bern very soon. So...may I ask the rest of the story now...?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...Yes. That is why I came to you.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: King Zephiel was an outstanding pupil is his studies, he was skilled in warcraft... He grew to be the perfect heir for the king.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: That is correct.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: But still, the former king did not look kindly at him.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: In fact... Our father began to hate Zephiel because he grew to become such a brilliant and worthy youth.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What...is that supposed to mean...?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Our father was a man of ordinary skill and intellect. Therefore, Zephiel’s outstanding skill made our father cold towards him.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Jealousy...?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: And then one day, our father told Zephiel that ‘the next heir to Bern would be Guinevere’s husband.'

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What! That’s awful!

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: But Zephiel was very patient. He said that he did not mind even if he could not gain the throne. But the people around us, who were looking forward to Zephiel’s ability to be a good king, would not allow anyone else to be the heir. Pressured by the public, our father lost his patience at last, and...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Decided to kill King Zephiel...?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: At a banquet, our father gave Zephiel a poisoned drink from his own hands. And that was the first and last cup that Zephiel took from our father. After returning to his room, Zephiel started to get sick. For ten days and nights, Zephiel lingered between life and death. But Murdock, Zephiel’s teacher and loyal general, saved his life.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...The former king never did anything after that?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: No... But I have heard that he had plans to get rid of Murdock and Zephiel’s mother as traitors. He was scheming to murder them all along with Zephiel. After hearing that, Zephiel made believe that he was dead. Our father then checked the coffin to confirm Zephiel’s death. At that moment, Zephiel rose up from the coffin and...with his sword...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: I was but a child then, so naturally I could not have understood what was going on. All I knew is that after our father died, Zephiel never smiled again. Until then, he was strict at times, but he was always a kind and loving brother to me. So...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: So I... At the bottom of my heart, I trust that Zephiel can change, that he can become that loving brother again. I...had to take action.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I...see...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...But now, my brother is in a place where my words cannot reach him. Roy, please... Please stop him. Please stop him from inflicting pain and suffering to the people of Bern...and the rest of Elibe.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Even if it may resolve to the blade?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...I have made my resolve when I entrusted this task to you.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I see. You have my word and loyalty, Princess Guinevere. I swear to the Fire Emblem that I will stop King Zephiel!
